facts: Bananas are berries, while strawberries are not.
Greek yogurt is higher in protein and lower in sugar compared to regular yogurt.
Drinking green tea may help boost metabolism and promote weight loss due to its catechin content.
Raw honey has natural antibacterial properties and can be used topically to promote wound healing.
Eating a handful of nuts daily may help reduce the risk of heart disease and improve overall health.
Chewing gum can help reduce cravings and improve focus.
Pineapples were so rare in 18th century Europe that they became a symbol of wealth and hospitality.
The world's most expensive spice is saffron. It can take up to 75,000 flowers to produce just one pound of saffron.
Chocolate was once used as currency. The Aztecs and Mayans used cacao beans as a form of currency.
Celery has negative calories, meaning it takes more energy for your body to digest it than the calories it contains.
